cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.AI, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with optimization problems in metric spaces, which is a common theme in computer science research related to algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The problem involves geometric objects such as line segments and disks, which suggests that computational geometry (cs.CG) is also a relevant sub-category. The use of an adversarial model and the focus on worst-case analysis suggests that the paper may also be relevant to research in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper involves optimization and approximation algorithms, which may be of interest to researchers in game theory (cs.GT).
